english: great unity; grand harmony; utopian ideal; Datong (place name)

etymology.description: 大 (great) + 同 (same/together) = great unity/harmony; also used as a toponym and era name.
etymology.interpretation: Evokes the classical ideal from the Lǐjì (礼记) passage on “大同,” envisioning a society of universal harmony and shared good. As a place or era name, it conveys aspiration toward unity and peace.

examples.chinese: 他向往大同社会(他嚮往大同社會)。
examples.english: He longs for a society of Great Unity.

examples.chinese: 许多人追求《礼记》里说的“大同”理想(許多人追求《禮記》裡說的「大同」理想)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō rén zhuīqiú Lǐjì lǐ shuō de “Dàtóng” lǐxiǎng.
examples.english: Many people pursue the Datong ideal described in the Book of Rites.

examples.chinese: 我们坐火车去了山西的大同(我們坐火車去了山西的大同)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zuò huǒchē qùle Shānxī de Dàtóng.
examples.english: We took a train to Datong in Shanxi.
